science.headline: Let's nitpick about the physics of Stranger Things, not its ending
science.teaser: Feedback has seen all the fuss about the finale of Stranger Things, but would like to point out that if we're going to dissect the plot, we have bigger things to worry about
science.tldr: Debunks physics inaccuracies in popular sci-fi shows like Stranger Things

science.headline: How to spot the lunar X and V
science.teaser: Time it right each month, and you can spot two fleeting tricks of light on the lunar surface. Abigail Beall is planning ahead
science.tldr: Observing these phenomena helps scientists better understand lunar geology patterns

philosophy.headline: Proximate Atrocities
philosophy.teaser: by Christopher Hall “The essence of repression lies simply in turning something away, and keeping it at a distance, from the conscious.” –Freud, “Repression” “Time and again, in conversation with friends, some of who have lost family members in this killing spree, there is a sense that one must be g
philosophy.tldr: Reveals how repression can distort our understanding of human nature

philosophy.headline: Art Beyond Entertainment
philosophy.teaser: by Chris Horner There are many great authors of the past who have survived centuries of oblivion and neglect, but it is still an open question whether they will be able to survive an entertaining version of what they have to say. —Hannah Arendt A book should be an ice axe for the frozen sea…
philosophy.tldr: Unearths the significance of forgotten authors' lasting contributions

society.headline: The Battle for Minneapolis
society.teaser: As Donald Trump brings his retribution to a liberal city, citizens, protesters, and civic leaders try to protect one another.
society.tldr: Disrupts social cohesion as Trump's policies take aim at Minneapolis

society.headline: Another Death in Minneapolis
society.teaser: After killing another American, federal officials again offer an explanation that appears to be directly contradicted by available evidence.
society.tldr: Contradicts official explanation with available evidence

society.headline: Gus Kenworthy Lived an Olympic Version of “Heated Rivalry”
society.teaser: Ahead of a comeback in Milan, the Olympic freestyle skier and actor discusses alley-oops, auditions, and coming out of the closet as a professional athlete.
society.tldr: Reveals Gus Kenworthy's authentic story amidst intense public scrutiny

society.headline: Yes, It’s Fascism
society.teaser: Until recently, I thought it a term best avoided. But now, the resemblances are too many and too strong to deny.
society.tldr: Recognizes the urgency of confronting and understanding fascist ideologies

society.headline: Tom Stoppard’s Secret—And Mine
society.teaser: Like the playwright, I grew up knowing nothing about my family's connection to the Holocaust.
society.tldr: Discovers that understanding one's family history is crucial to personal identity

society.headline: Trump’s Greenland Fiasco
society.teaser: The President caused a crisis in NATO and deepened European distrust toward the U.S. to end up with basically the same set of options that existed months ago.
society.tldr: Causes widespread distrust among European allies in NATO

society.headline: Restaurant Review: Wild Cherry
society.teaser: Inside a playhouse now owned by A24, a new restaurant offers frogs’ legs, a killer cheeseburger, and a heavy dose of haute-theatrical glamour.
society.tldr: Highlights A24's playhouse reimagining as a trendy new dining destination

society.headline: Witnessing Another Public Killing in Minneapolis
society.teaser: Videos of Alex Pretti’s fatal shooting, rapidly disseminated on social media, reveal a brazen display of brute power.
society.tldr: Raising awareness about police brutality matters to many communities nationwide

society.headline: International Law Is Holding Democracies Back
society.teaser: The United States should use this moment to argue for a different approach to the rules of war.
society.tldr: Challenges existing norms and encourages rethinking international law principles

society.headline: Minneapolis Is a Second Amendment Wake-Up Call
society.teaser: The federal killing of a Minnesota ICU nurse should worry every American.
society.tldr: Alarms are sounded as healthcare workers face increased Second Amendment threats

society.headline: Believe Your Eyes
society.teaser: People are risking their lives to document agents in Minneapolis.
society.tldr: Documenting agents matters because it overturns the status quo on surveillance

society.headline: Emily Nussbaum on Jane Kramer’s “Founding Cadre”
society.teaser: Her startling 1970 article, based on months of reporting on radical feminist pioneers, was an outlier for the period—coolly observational but full of emotion.
society.tldr: Reveals surprising truths about early radical feminism's founding pioneers

society.headline: The Ten Year Affair made me hate myself
society.teaser: Erin Somers’ adultery novel is targeted at downwardly mobile, media-adjacent millennials
society.tldr: Dismisses as misogynistic the portrayal of women in Erin Somers' novel

society.headline: Andy Burnham blocked from standing in Gorton and Denton
society.teaser: Claims of a stitch up by Starmer’s allies on the NEC have already been circulating
society.tldr: Rejects Burnham's candidacy, sparking claims of NEC interference

society.headline: Exclusive poll: Let Burnham stand, voters say
society.teaser: Over half of voters in Manchester think Labour is wrong to block him
society.tldr: Rejects the idea that Burnham's removal is necessary to Manchester

editorsPick.headline: Another Death in Minneapolis
editorsPick.teaser: After killing another American, federal officials again offer an explanation that appears to be directly contradicted by available evidence.
editorsPick.tldr: Contradicts official explanation with available evidence
